intro: Machaeranthera tanacetifolia var. bipinnatifida, commonly known as the bipinnatifid goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish composite flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the genus Machaeranthera.
